WorkItem.ClosedComment: Glad you sorted it out. Hopefully we can track down the root cause of some of these.
WorkItem.Description:
I have installed Visual Studio 2013 Express for Web and then Update 2. However, I cannot see any TypeScript templates (Project or Item) and if I just create a .ts file, it does not have any syntax highlighting.

How TypeScript should be enabled?

Comments.Message: The compiler itself seems to exist in C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft SDKs\TypeScript\1.0

It sounds like something might've gone awry with the install. Could you zip up the relevant contents of %TEMP% and attach them here so we can look at the install logs? Relevant here being the group of files like dd_TypeScript_*.log.

After that you might try doing a repair or reinstall of Update 2 and seeing if that works.

OK, I found the files and attached them with this message. I have already tried to reinstall Update 2 using the Repair option but that did not help.

This [Bug report](https://connect.microsoft.com/VisualStudio/feedback/details/874802/visual-studio-2013-express-update-2-no-typescript) seems to be exactly the same so I am not the only one having this issue.

Similar for me. I installed Express for Windows Update 2, then Express for Web and there was no typescript support in Web.
Repairing Update 2 didn't help.
I resolved my issue. I uninstalled both (Express for Window and for Web), then I installed only Express for Web and then Update 2 and it worked. Finally I installed Express for Windows.
